name: - Tips and Tricks
content:
Rolling Dice

In-line Rolls

  • Using double bracket [[  ]] allows you to do in-line rolls like so: [[1d20]].
  • You can do an immediate roll using just 1d20: [[1d20]]
    • Or a deferred roll (rolls in chat when clicked) by using /r 1d20: [[/r 1d20]]

Rerolling/Exploding

  • Using 3d6r1 or [[/r 3d6r1]] will allow you to do reroll dice (reroll on 1's).
  • Using 3d6x6 or [[/r 3d6x6]] will allow for continuous exploding dice (on 6's). 
  • Using 3d6xo6 or [[/r 3d6xo6]] will explode once.

Keeping/Dropping Results

  • kh, or k - keep highest:
    • /r 4d6k3 [[/r 4d6k3]] will keep the highest 3 rolls
  • kl will keep the lowest:
    • /r 2d20kl [[/r 2d20kl]] will basically roll disadvantage/misfortune
  • dl, or d will drop the lowest:
    • /r 4d6d [[/r 4d6d]] would be Standard for rolling ability scores
  • dh will drop the highest

Math and Descriptions

  • Math functions can be included in in-line rolls.
    • Max(5, 20): [[max(5, 20)]]
  • You can describe rolls using #
    • /r 1d20 #Perception Check [[/r 1d20 #Perception Check]]
  • You can also split rolls using descriptions. Click on the text in the chat card to expand.
    • /r 2d6[slashing]+1d8[fire] [[/r 2d6[slashing] + 1d8[fire]]]

 

There are a lot more things you can do with dice, see here for more documention.

 

Changes

  • Most values are listed via hovering over the appropriate value in the character sheet
  • Ability modifier: @abilities.con.mod
  • Ability modifier without temporary buffs (i.e. Rage): @abilities.con.baseMod
  • Changes can be set to Add to the value (+) or replace (=)
  • Scripts using js can also be used for changes, for more complicated things.
  • Not everything available in Pathfinder can currently be accomplished through changes
